While I really wanted it to work, this pair of coveralls just didn't fit me the way I hoped it would. I have a long torso and short legs, and this wound up feeling really snug in the groin area and super long, even with the cropped length. One thing I do want to call out for my other utilitarian ladies – this pair of coveralls is button-front. loved it

I am short so finding jumpsuits that are not dragging on the ground is hard. I am 5'4" and the xs fit perfect for my height. It was comfortable, classy, and stylish. I wore it to a couple yacht clubs while vacationing in FL.

Wore this on a trip to Mexico for daytime meals/shopping. Love the smocked detailing and the tie at the waist. It's very flattering! I am 5'8 and the jumpsuit was barely ankle-length on me - makes shoe selection tricky. Also the straps on this are so annoying. You have to loop the hook through one loop of fabric and then attach it to a second. It kept coming undone and looked super sloppy, ugh. Not purchasing.

I could only find one strap when I went to wear this, so had to wear it as a tube top with a jacket over it. Got a lot of compliments on this one. Was very easy and comfortable to wear to the office and then out to dinner.
This jumpsuit is so cute and comfy! Wore it out to a bar in Florida and got so many compliments! Was pretty true to size, I probably could have sized down but it’s pretty loose so it was fine

I lived in this jumpsuit during my two-week trip to an island in Panama. It's perfect for throwing on to wear around the house while hanging out, over a suit to the beach, even dressed up for dinner & dancing! The stretchy bodice and wide legs ensured a perfect, flattering fit (even if you're in between size) and I felt like I always looked fashionable while wearing it. Flowy, comfy, sexy, fun - ALL THE THINGS! I'm already planned to rent again in summer months.
This jumpsuit was so comfortable I regret not buying it :)
This jumpsuit is SO cute! Straps are removable and unfortunately mine only came with one strap so I had to wear it strapless. I’m 5’5 and wore flats and the length was perfect, didn’t drag at all.
This actually has like a little bit of pink in it too, so it’s way cuter in person. My stomach isn’t perfectly flat after 2 c-sections, and this was super flattering on me.

I’m not a big fan of the gathered top on this piece. It looked nice when standing still but was difficult to walk in because of the very full drapey legs. I liked the lightweight fabric. I’ve tried a couple jumpsuits & have realized I love the idea but don’t like. Too much of a hassle when you have to go.
loved this so much! i'm typically a s/m in other brands so the xs fit me perfectly per usual with FP. i definitely want to rent it again in red!

Super cute piece, I took on vacation to Oahu and wore out to dinner but the bust was just way too big. I’m a 34B and not sure an XS would of even fit. Length was perfect and overall style was flattering other than that. Probably great for bustier ladies :)
I absolutely did not want to give this back !!!! It’s sooo soft and comfortable!!!! Basically like wearing pj’s all day :)))) love love it ! Will rent again forsure

This was super comfy and I almost considered buying it - my husband vetoed it based on the "look:cost" ratio. The straps fell out of the hooks ALL THE TIME, and it was so long on me I tripped at least 4 times a day when I wore it out with shoes (I'm 5'3). Definitely would take a sewing machine to it if I bought it. The material is really super sheer, which would make it perfect for hot days. I really dig this and am going to keep my eyes out for a sale. I don't think it's worth the money considering the strap situation.

This fit great and was very comfortable. I usually stay away from jumpsuits because I have big hips but a small upper body, but this fit perfectly and was very flattering. Note that the fabric is thin so it's best worn in warmer weather!
Such a cute lightweight jumpsuit but not for tall girls. I’m 5’8” and I could just barely make it passable with flats. Would be so adorable for shorter ladies with some cute heels.

Ok so I loved this jumpsuit so hard. Wore it all day in Mexico - tons of compliments - BUT - my feet kept getting caught in the hems and I almost fell in my face no less than three different times in front of other people. I was terrified to carry a plate of food lest I trip and sling it everywhere. I would buy it if it weren’t for the extreme trip hazard. :)

links_reviews_title: Loved it! Wore it to my cousins baby shower!
links_reviews_text: Great!
This is a pretty, slightly dress-uppy jumpsuit to wear out to a casual birthday dinner. I loved it and wish I could have worn it more!

I LOVED this. I wore it for a friend's casual rehearsal dinner, with a pair of wedge sandals and a jean jacket. The wedding was in Florida in February, so daytime temps were warm but once the sun went down it was cold outside; this jumper was perfect for both temps. It was super comfortable and I really liked that I could dress it up or down.
Really cute jumpsuit, love the color.

links_reviews_title: far too short not like picture
links_reviews_text: You would expect the length to cover your feet and be oversized like the picture but it was completely opposite. The leg literally came above my ankle and is the most awkward length ever. Also which im very mad about the jumpsuit came without a strap. So i have to wear it strapless which is annoying. If the length were longer i would absolutely love it bc the color and idea is very cute.
This did not look good on me because I have a thicker waist so it made me look a bit grumpy. If you have a narrow waist this will probably work better for you.

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable and easy to wear
links_reviews_text: It has pockets. Enough said. Wore it with sneaks, wedges, and a jacket when it got cold

links_reviews_title: cute but the straps don't stay.
links_reviews_text: cute but the straps don't stay.

links_reviews_title: Want to borrow again in the Spring/Summer
links_reviews_text: Great piece! I would wear as a bandeau and tuck in the straps. Fits well and quality is great.
Easy to look chic yet being totally comfortable. It is a little sheer but nothing some shape wear underneath can’t fix. Totally worth it!
Beautiful colors I wouldn’t normally wear. Flows and fits nicely.
Cute and comfy to throw on with a white denim jacket . Can dress it up or wear it casual .

This is soooooo comfy and cute. The only issue I had were that the straps kept detaching and falling off. Other than that, it was perfect. I found that it fit true to size, but if you're between sizes I would size down, it has a lot of give. Very flattering piece.
a little too boxy for me.
work or casual
This shirt was just ok. The fabric was stiffer than I expected, which made it sit a little awkwardly. But the details are cute and I did get a few compliments.
Cute top. I wore it to work and happy hour. Looks nice with dark jeans and booties.

Nice blouse, overall - the fabric is nice, the styling (with the little ruffle at the bottom and the pin-tucking) is cute, and it's well constructed - but it's just so boring! When I get Nuuly items, I want things that are a bit trendy - that I would like to wear for a while, but wouldn't want to be part of my "basics" (the clothes that every closet should have that never really go out of style). I would consider this blouse to be a good solid basic item. Not really interesting.
Really flattering blouse; great for work!

The buttons on this top made it unwearable. They were so tough to get buttoned/unbuttoned I would have had to plan on an extra 10 min getting dressed. Top was ok, not cute enough to mess with the buttons. I never ended up wearing it.
Such an easy dress to wear. The lines make it super flattering. Absolutely perfect for a hot summer day!
Sleeves are super cute, but definitely size down. This dress runs way large, and I wish I had a size smaller than I normally would order. Fabric is way soft though.
This tunic was high quality, comfortable fabric and very cute but was just too big to wear. I am usually a small, but was 6 months pregnant, so ordered the medium and it was like a potato sack.
Cute dress, a little boxy. definitely got a few compliments!

links_reviews_title: Cute dress but the giant sleeves made layering impossible
links_reviews_text: Got this for a conference in FL but the weather was cold. The bell of the sleeves was so big I couldn't layer a jacket or sweater over it, so it sat in the closet. I may get it again in the summer though.
I really wanted to like this dress, but it was huge and weird on me - it looked like a sack, a belt didnt help.
Fit perfectly, great with a turleneck under, great quality
I wore this to a 1920s formal charity event and it was perfect for the occasion. Ran really big. I’m usually a 12 and fit more like a 14/16 but still worked.

The dress ran a little big in the top (straps were long and not adjustable) so I think I would size down next time. The length was great on me (a couple inches below the knee) but I am tall so beware to the shorter ladies. Overall, I really loved wearing it. It has a roaring 20s vibe to it and is really breezy and easy to wear.

I am short and curvy on the bottom. Runs large should have sized down even though got petite. Usually love anything embellished but even with a belt and heel boots just didn’t work. May have worked if another size down??? First thing from nully that I never wore

Did not like anything about this dress. I am 5’8” & the length was mid-calf. Very unflattering for an unfitted dress. It hung like a baggy sack. The irregular sheer hem was also awful. I tried belting it but it was unsaveable.
Super obsessed. Super versatile and can be dressed up and down, with or without a belt. Beautiful piece

links_reviews_title: Itchy fabric, hard to get on and off
links_reviews_text: This dress hit me above my natural waist and was very uncomfortable. I had a hard time with the fabric button at the back neck and since I live alone, I had a panic moment where I thought, "What if I can't get out of this dress???" It's cute, but I wouldn't wear it outside of quarantine.
This dress fit amazing and was beautiful. I didn’t realize how dressy it was in person so didn’t have a place to wear it.

I would wear this dress again and again if Corona Virus did not made all of us stay home and go back to yoga pants. Keep in mind that for 5'5 person it is very long so be prepare to wear high heals. I paired it with anthropology booties and Loft's leather belt and felt like a million bucks!
I got so many compliments on this dress! Definitely a favorite!
I love this dress! It it true to size and can be dressed up or down. I didn't have a belt to wear with it like the model but I thought it looked fine without it! Would rent again.

The print, the construction, the style- everything about this dress was so lovely! I loved the moody colors paired with the whimsy of paisley and ruffled tiers of skirt. Seriously, true love. I wore it to a high tea with my mom.
I've never received so many compliments. I wore it to a luncheon with heels and nice jewelry.

I wore this dress to work today because it's almost time for me to return my items and I hadn't worn it yet. The dress fits really well and looks great with boots. In the spring I think I can still wear it with heels before it gets too warm. I've already gotten about 5 compliments on this dress today...so I just bought it.
Loved this item. Will be purchasing.
Great maxi dress. Fits slim enough through the waist and hip to carry the print and still flatter. I got lots of compliments!

Considered buying this, I liked it so much. Fit is good, even for tall girls. A lot of fabric, but not overwhelming at all. I added a belt, but it also looked fine without. Got loads of compliments from strangers.

I don't know if this dress didn't work for me because I am apple shaped or WHAT! But I sized up and it was still awkwardly tight on me, especially in the stomach... which is weird because it appears to be a super A-line cut... I figured sizing up would fix any issues but I would say this dress runs about 2 sizes small, depending on how you like things to fit and how your body is shaped. Definitely a bummer!
Loved everything about it.

links_reviews_title: Cute but Short for taller girl
links_reviews_text: I really like Maxi dresses to hit the floor which can be hard to find. This was very cute a little outside my normal style and comfortable but I would have loved it a smidge longer for my height. Great for shorter gals!

I wore this with flats since I’m tall. It was a beautiful dress. I wore it to church twice and it felt amazing. I planned to maybe wear to a client visit but it felt a little too flowy to be appropriate.

links_reviews_title: Not for me...Pretty pattern but weird cut
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to be able to wear this dress but unfortunately the tiered skirt, the way it gathered around my middle was very unflattering and made my stomach look huge! The top fit fine so I think it was more about the cut and my body shape rather than the dress being too small. I was also not a fan of the polyester like fabric and there seemed to be a lot of it. I am 5'9 and the dress hit my ankles which was a perfect maxi length. I think if you have a flat stomach and are less curvy; more on the skinny side you would really like this.
The fabric is beautiful, and on someone without curves, I'm sure it would look gorgeous and drapey, but it just felt frumpy on me. :(
Great long sleeve max; fits TTS and looks great with boots and Jean jacket - little long but fine with heeled boot.
Hugs all the right places and is the right length! I’m 5’6 130 and got a size 2 fit perfectly
Got so many compliments wearing this! Wore it with flat cowboy booties to work and then heeled teal boots for an event.

I went out of my comfort zone with this bad boy. And sometimes your comfort zone is where you should stay. While I am by no means the body type of the model, it was startling how bad this fit with a seam below the chest and above the waist - essentially accentuating the place most of us aren't looking to accentuate. Other than the fit - the quality was nice, the pattern pretty, and the length/skirt syle was fun! Good luck!
This dress is gorgeous and if it was any other print would be super formal. As such you can dress it down. Tons of compliments especially on the sleeves and twirlability if this dress.
I LOVED this dress. Very comfortable, beautiful pattern and I got so many compliments!

links_reviews_title: A lot of print but not in a bad way
links_reviews_text: I was worried that due to the fact that the dress was long and with long sleeves the print might be a bit much and I would look like wallpaper or an old sofa. But not the case at all the tailoring is excellent and I wore it with and without a belt. Preferred with but overall comfortable and lovely dress.

I looovee this dress! I'm so sad to part with it. It fits so well and worked great for a day at the office. The top if flowy so it fit my larger boobs and the waist actually came in enough to not need a belt - I just liked to break it up with the belt. A MUST RENT.
I LOVED this dress. It's got a little bit of ruching on the waist line that made the fit very flattering. I'm between 5'2" and 5'3" and the petite was perfect for me with a pair of 2' booties.
Great maxi! I was able to wear this to dress up my "western" look.
Wore this to a baby shower and to work and got so many compliments I decided to buy it! Fabric is nice and fit was perfect.

After reading other reviews, I ordered a size 4 (normally a 6). It fit perfect! The waist has a bit of a faux-belt and it makes for a wonderful silhouette. I absolutely love this pattern and this dress is the perfect weight for spring/fall. I believe this dress would be flattering on any body type. The only issue I had with it is that the neckline is a bit funky. Otherwise, absolutely wonderful dress!

Loved the 70s vibe of this dress but beware if you carry any weight in your mid-section. I generally vary between a size 10 and size 12 and this size 12 was so tight in the waist that I could not wear it.

I never wore this. I'm 5'10" and this dress hit one inch above the ankle. Because there is so much fabric on top, it just looks unbalanced and made me look larger than I am. There is also a panel of fabric that goes from waist to mid-thigh which cuts the skirt in half randomly and is not flattering. I think this would work on shorter women.

This dress was extremely flattering on! It cinches right at the tiniest part of your waist and makes you look really long and slim. The pics online do not do it justice. I have never received so many compliments on a dress before.

links_reviews_title: WOW, even better than I expected.
links_reviews_text: This dress was honestly a showstopper. I wore it to a cocktail evening event and got lots of compliments and felt super appropriate. I'm very busty, and the dress was just a hair snug across my chest, but I think if I had worn a different bra I wouldn't have had that issue. perfectly fitted on my waist and flared out for the most flattering maxi dress I've ever worn. Perfect for fall/winter wear! Also, I'm only 5' 2" and the length was so perfect, I was shocked. This one might stay in my closet forever.

Cute skirt. Paired it with a knotted graphic tee. The waistband is poorly made and was all twisted, but I sized up so it was fine. Definitely ran small, as I am usually a medium and the large was perfect.

This is a nice skirt but it definitely is for a specific body type. I think this runs true to size - I normally wear a medium in bottoms but got a large based on the other reviews and it was a bit more loose than I would like. Material is thin.
I felt like an angel in this!

links_reviews_title: Thin satin-y midi skirt w/ elastic waistband
links_reviews_text: Loved this skirt for everyday wear to work or for date night. It is a thinner satin-y material with slits on both sides. On a warmer winter day with boots was perfect. Love the color, cut and style. You'll get a lot of wears out of this piece.

Elastic waist fit fine but the hip area was just a bit too tight. Also its hard to tell from the photos but it actually has 2 slits; one up each side - I ordered this thinking it would be fine for work but the slits were just a bit too revealing for my comfort.

This piece was a little cutie. The cut + fit were perfect and overall it was very flattering. Difficult to tuck a shirt into because of how thin the material was and it bunched a bit but not a deal breaker at all. Almost kept it!!
I wish this had fit better. With larger hips/butt in relation to my waist, this was not a flattering skirt on me.

...but it was not made for my body type (wide hips). This skirt is better for someone with a straight body type because the silky fabric isn't very forgiving. Sad I couldn't wear, because I love the style!

These pants were a little baggy throughout which was part of the look, but if I had to do it over again I’d go one size down. Wore them many times. May flatter someone who’s curvier in the bottom more than they did my straight legs.
I’m a solid 28 but these were sooo tight I’m not sure a 29 would fit. Sad, they are really cute.

I loved these so much I bought them. I found them to be a great upgrade to a basic pair of straight-leg blue jeans. The seam along the side feels sturdy and like it will hold up over time. I sized up because there were no reviews and I'm really glad I did because they fit me perfectly!
Lived in these. Would have purchased if I had more money to spare. Perfect amount of stretch and distress, perfect length (which is impossible for me). Great everyday jean!
Just high-waisted enough. Easy to dress up or down. I liked the sturdiness of the denim. I'll definitely rent these again
Cute jeans, they had a little too much stretch for me, after wearing for a short time they got saggy and bagged out a little. Did like the highwaist and the color.

These jeans are really cute! I got lots of compliments, but I am tall and want my belly button covered by the waist and these did not do that. They also run a bit big in size and stretch a lot. Overall, would recommend- especially if you like a lower rise.
Wish these came in petites so they didn’t look like high waters
I accidentally ordered a size down but they ended up fitting perfectly! I'm 5'5 and they hit my ankle at the exact right height. Super comfy material as well.

This pair actually replaced the original ones I ordered and since I didn't order it, I wasn't able to research whether it was going to be too big or too small. That said, I'm usually an 8 in jeans, 29 as well. And this pair of 29s fit too loose.
These looked like a kick flare on the model, but were more like bell bottoms. I Wore them once but the style isn’t an every day look for me.
I love the wash of these jeans and the flare but they gaped so far out behind my back/above my butt that they looked kinda dumb on me.
These jeans are amazing! They fit great, not too tight around the waist but I noticed the more I wore them they stretched out a little bit. The color is great and the denim super soft.
Too tight and long - great wash and denim weight.

So cute on the model, but they hit at the most awkward point. Not quite ankle, but not quite full length either. I usually like mine ankle length or a bit shorter to show off booties or mules, but these were just off. Also, lower rise than I like, stiffer denim...just something off about them. Tried on, but never wore. Ordered up to 31 (usually 29) which was the right call. These are more rigid, v little stretch.
Runs true to size, and has a great fit! Super comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Loved them - just wish they were a bit smaller
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved these jeans, they were a great wash and cut! They run a bit large so I wasn't able to wear them more than a few times once they started to stretch out just a bit. If you're on the shorter side, like me, they don't fit quite like the photos, they ended up looking more like a regular flare jean that was just a bit shorter than floor length, still really cute though.

I really loved the way these jeans felt. The material was super soft (for jeans) and I wore them on a 5 hour flight and was very comfortable! They were stretchy but definitely true to size. I washed them a few times and they got a little tight but because of the stretchy material they always fit. My legs are pretty small but they were def tight around my legs on the top not really like they are pictured on the model. Since they were a bit more fitted, the flare is a bit wider than pictured, nothing crazy. I would 100% rent these again and recommend them!

These jeans were true to size and comfortable. I love the rip in the knee and bottom hem detailing on the pant leg. My only issue with them is that they were pretty low to mid-rise, so it was hard to wear with cropped shirts and sweaters.

Love these jeans. They are so comfy I wore them for an entire day of dress shopping and even after the bloat from the champagne they still fit amazingly. Also wore them out and look great with booties or sneakers. They were a perfect mid/highish rise fit.
If you don't like tight jeans get these. They are very comfortable but definitely run big,
Really soft, but it tight in the waist. Would size up.
beautiful, feminine blouse, LOVE the fabric and pattern. The fit is very odd. I'm guessing that this blouse actually fits a very narrow window of people.

I loved the style of the shirt however the keyhole gasped open and it looked odd with a tank underneath. I was excited to wear, but it wasn’t functional for work. Overall very cute concept but didn’t fit my body right.

links_reviews_title: Exposed everything - def couldn’t wear for work or going out
links_reviews_text: Couldn’t wear it
Loved this top! Great for going out and I got a lot of compliments. Typically not a xs but it fit perfectly. It is low cut as a lot of people mention so I ended up pinning it.
Wore this out to an upscale restaurant and felt very confident in it. Flattering fit with just a little sparkle in it.
But definitely does gap. Tape to the rescue.
Cut low with no modesty closure, so if you have a smaller chest it's a bit roomy. Otherwise true to size.
Runs slightly big, very low cut
Such a cute and bold piece! I obsessed over this item when getting it! I got a size small and it was a little bit of a bigger fit, would have probably gotten a size down had I known. Still loved it!
I tried it on once, but I had a hard time finding what to pair with it! It's definitely a looker though.

Absolutely loved this jacket! The fit was amazing and the look is so fun. I wore this on the weekend more (I have a corporate job lol), and it was the perfect pop to an outfit. FYI the color is very bold - like aluminum foil .. very shiny, just be aware!
I never had the opportunity to wear it since I have been quarantined. But it is beautiful!!
Loved this jacket! I am usually a small in jackets, but decided on the medium because I wanted to layer underneath and the medium wasn't big at all! Highly recommend.

links_reviews_title: Reallllly Wanted to Keep This Gem
links_reviews_text: This was probably my most worn rental. The possibilities were endless! I went true to size and am glad I did. I had plenty of room even with long sleeve tops. If you wanted to wear a sweater under I might go up one size. It would be cute oversized too!

links_reviews_title: Fun jacket to wear a few times
links_reviews_text: I've gotten a ton of compliments every time I've worn this. It isn't something I'd buy because I think I'd tire of it, so perfect for Nuuly.

I love this jacket so much, it's a real statement piece. I got so many compliments on it, it really elevates an outfit. I wore it over a black body suit and high waisted black denim, and also did it with more casual jeans and a shirt, it's pretty much amazing with anything. I still have it and am considering purchasing.
Fit was perfect and it was a fun jacket to wear, wore it to a wine tasting on galentines day and had tons of compliments

I wanted to love this but it kind of felt like I was wearing a shiny foil jacket. It was a bit too loud for me but if I had a themed party or something to have worn it to I would have been all over it. Just something I would not wear for no reason. The material felt great though it didn’t feel cheap at all.

Only wore once, but thats just because it was such a statement piece. I am between a small and medium and this was true to size for a medium, but I think I should have gone small so it was a little more form fitting.
Thought it would be cuter but kinda felt like a robot, It was eh
Love this jacket. Threw it on with simple black jeans and black booties and it made me feel so effortlessly fabulous. Great rent.
I got soooo many compliments in this cute jacket. It caught everyone's eye as soon as I walked by. Size Medium fit perfectly
This jacket was so fun! I got lots of compliments on it when I wore it and definitely felt fashionable. I felt that it didn't run small, so wished I would have ordered a M versus the L.
I came, I wore, and I send it back since the world saw me coming and going in my super sweet metallic jacket!
LOVE this jacket! It's a beautiful statement piece, the fit is great too. Wore it to a concert, got so many compliments.
I sized up based on reviews but was way too big on my frame. Cute but not flattering bc of the size

links_reviews_title: Baked potato but make it fashion
links_reviews_text: This jacket is beautiful, edgy and unique. I knew when I pulled it out of the bag that I loved it. What I did not love was how small it ran. I couldn’t even begin to meet the zippers from both sides of the front to zip up. If you have a C or bigger chest and want to wear this jacket closed, you may want to find another jacket to rent. If the siZe was larger or they offered a size larger than a Large I would seriously have considered buying this item. I will wear it open and pretend that this is how it was made. Overall, if you are petite and looking for an edgy jacket that literally goes with anything, this may be the one to try.
Beautiful pattern but very strange and unflattering fit. Was also very wrinkled upon receiving. Never wore :(

links_reviews_title: Made my shoulders look v broad
links_reviews_text: Cute print but looked way too boxy on me.

links_reviews_title: Very versatile, wore with so many different things. I loved it
links_reviews_text: It’s a little baggie, but tucked in or loose it is so cute.
Wore with jeans. Super easy to wear and the color is gorgeous!
This was a cute shirt! Fit true to size, color is beautiful in real life, and can be worn with a lot of different pant options. A good shirt for the office.
I’m usually between a M and L, but in this top I could have used a S

links_reviews_title: Cute everyday top for work or play
links_reviews_text: Great pattern and cut. Looks cute with mid rise denim. Has some olive green accents so paid with a great jacket for a work event!
I like this top and the pattern. It is pretty flimsy material and i don't love enough to purchase, but I wore it to work a few times.
I love this top! Cute, comfy and compliments galore!
The print was beautiful and the colors are great. Gave this four stars because the collar was a little awkward
Pretty colors, easy and comfy to wear. Wore it with slim bottoms as couldn’t figure out how to make tuckingwork.

links_reviews_title: Baggy shape didn't do much for me
links_reviews_text: I am really petite and I sort of drowned in this. I know the style is supposed to be flowy, but I didn't find it especially flattering. I think if I were a bit less narrow it might work better, especially in the petite cut. I did love the color and got a few wears out of it, so it wasn't too bad just underwhelming.
Nice color nice print. Visited my daughter and she wore it beautifully.

Nothing super special, it is one of those wardrobe workhorses that you can easily throw on and know that it will look cute. I wore it under sweaters and jean jackets, and on its own. The color and print are really nice. Good transitional piece during spring's up and down weather.
This shirt is a fun option for work! It tucked in to jeans really well. The small was a perfect fit and wasn't too snug for a 34D.
Wore this both with jeans and black pants. Was easy to pack on trips. Light fabric, comfortable.
It was a nice blouse, great for work and weekends. Nothing WOW but I wore it a lot.
Not flattering too much fabric
Great top, i wore it a bunch and got lots of compliments.
Easy, fun top to throw on anyday. Also very comfy. Larger than expected but i think it’s supposed to be that way.
The color of this one was very pretty but the shirt definitely runs big. Wish I would have tried the Med instead.
Fabric is great- doesn’t easily wrinkle and feels classy. I wore it tied in the front with high waist jeans.

links_reviews_title: Super cute fabric but runs large
links_reviews_text: Would have loved to have worn this more but it was just too big. Gorgeous fabric.
Really pretty blouse. I didn't think I would like the pattern,but once I put it on, I really liked it. Nice material, good flow, ran a little but large.
